title: Ahmaud Arbery Murder: Jury Selection Begins in Federal Hate-Crimes Trial
sub_head: Gregory McMichael, Travis McMichael and William ‘Roddie’ Bryan Jr. were convicted in state court for Mr. Arbery’s murder and are serving life sentences
body:
Jury selection began Monday in the federal hate-crimes trial of three men charged in the killing of Ahmaud Arbery, a 25-year-old Black man who was chased and fatally shot in February 2020 while out jogging in southeast Georgia.
Defendants Gregory McMichael, his son Travis McMichael and William “Roddie” Bryan Jr. have already been convicted in state court for the murder of Mr. Arbery.
